article.title: Toward a Galactic Distribution of Planets. I. Methodology & Planet Sensitivities of the 2015 High-Cadence Spitzer Microlens Sample

choices: The planet sensitivity profile for a typical microlensing event.
The stellar number density profile toward the Baade\'s window.
The distribution of microlensing events in the Galactic plane.
The mass distribution of microlenses in the Galactic bulge.

multiple_choice_question.text: What information does Figure 2 provide about lens distances?
choices: The relative parallax is a more precise indicator of lens distance than the proper motion.
The proper motion is a more precise indicator of lens distance than the relative parallax.
Both relative parallax and proper motion provide equally precise estimates of lens distance.
Neither relative parallax nor proper motion provides useful information about lens distance.

multiple_choice_question.text: What criterion is used to exclude events from the final statistical sample in Figure 7?
choices: Events with a median D8.3 greater than 5 kpc.
Events with a median lens mass greater than 0.5 solar masses.
Events with a D8.3 uncertainty greater than 1.4 kpc.
Events with a lens mass uncertainty greater than 20%.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the quantity Î·b2d in Equation (38) represent?
choices: The ratio of planet detections in the bulge to planet detections in the disk.
The ratio of planet sensitivity in the bulge to planet sensitivity in the disk.
The ratio of microlensing events in the bulge to microlensing events in the disk.
The ratio of stellar mass in the bulge to stellar mass in the disk.
